column4: hi, i have sources in $HOME/Desktop/MyProjects/<projectName>/src i wish to make documentations out of the javadoc comments in my file.I have read the options in ant -help and javadoc -help but i still cant figure, anyone know  how i would go about the process of making the <projectName>-javadoc.jar file?
this isn't really a ubuntu question is it
i know, its just that ##java and #netbeans are as good as useless
but i assume you are using ubuntu to do this operation
yea
so the real question is : what ubuntu packages can i install that let me create code documentation from my source code comments
maybe
if only you were using python...
several keywords come to me at the moment : doxy & java-doc
ok, i have javadoc and ant installed
i wont be much help though since i don't know much about java
not even that yet only javascrip,html,css and lua so far
so you are a web developer, i was once their but i found more fun in linux which eventually brewed my interest in application programming
have you looked at doxygen?
whatever that is?
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doxygen
im reading it, thanks for that link, looks quit helpful
yes i think it is what you want to achieve
why would you want to remove pulseaudio ?
if its causing problems you're doing something wrong or following bad advice
i just wanted to be sure if its important, if not, flush it out of my startup apps
why ?
is it because of OCD
normally i just people on ignore that shout...
